author: Guardian readers
title: Mountain huts and lodges in Europe: readers’ travel tips
text:
Related: Intrepid walks to stretch your legs
Winning tip: ‘Volcano huts’, Iceland The 15-mile Fimmvörðuháls trail takes you from the coastal greenfields of Skógar, past waterfalls, mountain goats and the famous the Eyjafjallajökull volcano, which erupted in 2010 . It can be a tough slog in a day, especially in the snow, which can stick around until late June despite warm weather. A great place to break your journey to Thórsmörk is the Baldursskali volcano hut. It’s in an isolated spot, so most days you’ll only see couple of wardens, their dog an half a dozen walkers. If tackling nearby Laugavegurinn trail, book overnight huts through the Icelandic Touring Association .
Dorm from £34, advance booking advised, volcanohuts.com
Brightey
L’Alivi, Corsica The gite d-etape “L’Alivi” is in the tiny village of Serriera on the fantastic six-day Mare e Monti (Nord) trail in Corsica. You’ll find a good bed in a rustic stone building that was once the village’s olive press and mill, and the food here was some of the best we had in Corsica. We ate herb tart, wild-boar lasagne and a local cheese, served with homemade fig preserve. Breakfasts are no less generous and there are packed lunches (€7), too.
Dorm from €18, doubles/private dorm also available, alivi.fr
bryfox
Astrakas refuge, Greece Facebook Twitter Pinterest “We prefer the traditional ways”, said the refuge manager. “Anyway, it’s cheaper. We can’t afford helicopter supplies!” We were staying in the Astrakas refuge, nearly 2,000 metres high (and powered by solar panels), in the mountains of northern Greece. It is open from May to October, serves food and has simple dorms and cold showers. Enjoy the peaks and tarns of Mount Gamila and take the well-marked paths to the Dragon Lake, or to the Vikos gorge and cobbled tracks of the Zagoria. Bed from €13, astrakarefuge.com
JaneSLaurie
Polish mountain shelter In between crystal-clear lakes and encircled by the jagged peaks of the Tatra mountains is the Polish Tourist Society mountain shelter. This is the only lodge in the national park that can’t be reached by car and makes the perfect spot to break your trek. Refuel with a bowl of zurek , a hearty soup of sausage, onion and potatoes, before taking an evening stroll to see the wildflowers or the Siklawa waterfall.
Dorm from £7 a night, piecstawow.pl
Rachel Thorley
Casa Vita B&B, Tuscany, Italy A wonderful rural place on the Via Francigena, an old pilgrim route from Cantebury to Rome . Owner Carlo, a medieval archeologist, and wife Katerina provide maps, do guided tours and serve memorable food.
Doubles from €85, casavitaonci.it
robwrate
Camping Isabena, French Pyrenees Related: A summer clean for the Alps
After a long hike in the Pyrenees, camp here on the edge of a small town called La Puebla de Roda. It’s run by a very friendly and welcoming German/Spanish family. Take in the lovely mountain scenery and look for palaeocene and eocene marine fossils, which are plentiful. A little further away there are stunning lakes and rustic towns.
Pitches from €11.30, adults €4.50 isabena.eu
Nicholas Murray
Berggasthaus Aescher, Switzerland Facebook Twitter Pinterest Photograph: Alamy The unusually themed Appenzell Whisky Trek brings you to this guesthouse in a relatively little-visited part of eastern Switzerland. The hostel is built into a cliff with dorm beds and a hearty, no-nonsense breakfast, as you’d expect, but it’s the stunning location that elevates it to greatness.
Dorm £30 B&B, aescher-ai.ch
unguarded
Rifugio Selleries, Italy Facebook Twitter Pinterest Meals made with local produce and wine from the valleys below make this hut the perfect stop on a six-day tour of the Orsiera-Rocciavré natural park . Try homemade cheese and buckwheat polenta and venison dishes. The owners also make their own génépi liqueur. Beds are in dorms but the common room is spacious.
Dorm from €35 B&B, rifugioselleries.it
AuroraP
Capanna Leìt, Swiss Alps This hut in the village of Dalpe, in the Italian-speaking part of Switzerland, is surrounded by spectacular mountains. Trek around Pizzo Campolungo’s mountain lakes, or walk three hours to Fusio, a village in the Maggia valley. You should see marmots, lizards and birds of prey, and you may even discover a rare black tourmaline in the granite. At Fusio, visit the church and old mills, and stay at the local hostel – Ostello Comunale .
From £17 a night , capanna-leit.ch
alexandra1108
Agriturismo Zertin, Lake Como, Italy The Via dei Monti Lariani is a 125km trek at about 1,000m above the western shore of Lake Como . Don’t miss the section from Garzeno to Peglio, which passes several villages and has stirring views of the lake and the peaks beyond. Take a 2km detour at Peglio to Agriturismo Zertin, perched on a hillside above the village. This family-run farmstay is a haven of simple rooms and brilliant farm-to-plate cooking – try the pizzocheri and the home-cured salumi.
From €58pp half board, agriturismozertin.com
marthah
